  • Constructor Details

    • Party

      public Party​(java.lang.String name)

  • Method Details

    • sortCandidates

      public void sortCandidates()
      Description - This function will be used to sort the candidates ArrayList. It will access the number of ballots for each candidate in the ArrayList and put the candidate with the most ballots in the 0th position and the candidate with the least ballots in the last position. It will call the coinToss() to handle any ties.

    • calculateNumBallots

      public void calculateNumBallots()
      Calculate the total number of ballots for the party. Set the class variable pNumBallots to this sum.

    • addCandidate

      public void addCandidate​(Candidate c)
      Add individual candidates to the candidates ArrayList
      Parameters:
      c - candidate object, the new candidate to be added

    • coinToss

      public int coinToss​(int numTied)
      Break any ties throughout either algorithm. It takes in the number of candidates involved in the tie, and returns an integer representing the losing candidate. It will simulate 1000 coin tosses and take the 1001 result to ensure randomness.
      Parameters:
      numTied - an int, the number of objects with the same values
      Returns:
      option an int, the chosen
